> we can remove these, but not until after electra, so in an f* fork. They've been marked deprecated i believe for this release, but we can't just delete them until we've done the electra beacon-api release tag etc.

<@680234424037670912> this seems like double-counting things, in https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/pull/466

my understanding is the timeline is
- in the middle of Capella, `/eth/v3/validator/blocks/{slot}` appears and `/eth/v2/validator/blocks/{slot}` and `/eth/v1/validator/blinded_blocks/{slot}` get deprecated (but not removed, and can't assume anything because in the middle of a fork
- Deneb (at launch, i.e. all clients had to support it, so now across the network the new v3 + deprecated v1/v2 calls. people should have been adapting here. schedule was to remove by Electra
- "I do agree with the sentiment, but we probably want to hold off merging this until electra or they'll no longer be listed..." v2.5.0 is the "release" version, it's on the ethereum.github.io as the release version, if people use "dev" that's on them, it's not default and it's clearly marked as something not-yet-official-release
- " If it is not before Electra it might be fine to merge it already, the apis being removed from dev explorer shouldn't be an issue?" right, exactly
- "we can remove these, but not until after electra, so in an f* fork. They've been marked deprecated i believe for this release" this is where the double-counting comes in, no?
